aspace_helpers.title: delete C0140 from Sandbox and re-run import
box label transformation should also handle folders that are top containers

comments.body: Requesting that this revision to the script be undone. After consultation with ADAPT members, I was able to confirm that this is actually a non-issue- the fact that the script doesn't create labels for oversize folders- since we use oversize folders (as top containers) infrequently and need to add more detailed information than what's included in box labels. The team is ok with continuing to create these labels manually.

aspace_helpers.title: Add Aspace Environment Variables into ansible

comments.body:
@regineheberlein a few questions:

- does the ASPACE_URL need to be vaulted?
- I noticed that there are both `ASPACE_URL` and `ASPACE_STAGING_URL` environment variables in aspace_helpers.  Should both be set on each box?
- On a related note, I've used that test.rb script in the past as a quick check to make sure that authentication is working correctly -- but it's set to use `aspace_staging_login`.  Could we change it to `aspace_login` so it could test authenticating against either environment?  Or is there a better way to check authentication?

aspace_helpers.title: construct MARC record from C0140 ASpace component
Generating MARC records from C0140 EAD component records/archival objects in Resource records

comments.body: Welcome back @faithc ! Are these ready to go into production?

Thanks, @regineheberlein. After doing some QC, the Firestone team noted a few issues/questions: 

- Is there a way to see what the records would look like in the catalog?
- Items are identified as a Book rather than a Manuscript
- Will digital objects/content display in the catalog record? Examples: C0140_c97187-07864, C0140_c01027-94291 
- This one seems to have something weird going on with the creator getting put into a 700 field (with a lot of additional data in it) rather than 100: C0140_c85700-18433, also  
- This one also has the creator in 700 instead of 100 but doesnâ€™t have the extra data: C0140_c80184-00264

Thanks!

Thanks!

re: `#1`: Yes, we can index a few records in catalog staging.

re: `#2`: Do you have an example? They're hardcoded as "mixed materials", so that's surprising. There are some pre-existing records in the sandbox that you may have been looking at. I've deleted all but two from the sandbox (those two are linked so I don't want to touch them) and will re-import so you can confirm.

re: `#3`: at this time, we're not including ASpace instances. we can always add them later; feel free to put in a ticket.

re: `#4` and `#5`: yikes, that's a bug that's affecting 3 records. I'll take a look.

re: 1: Thanks, Regine. 

re: 2: Two examples: C0140_c00001 and C0140_c76598-42862

re: 3: Gotcha. 

re: 4: Thanks! 

FYI, I'll be out for the rest of the week starting tomorrow so I won't be able to return to this until next week.
Thanks for the heads up. Who should I tag in your absence?
You can tag @kellybolding or @LynnDurgin should any questions arise while I'm away, but this may need to wait until I get back. Thanks.

figgy.title: Only use dynamic UV config if it's a Figgy manifest.
Fix UV display  for non-Figgy manifests in Maps and Geospatial Data Portal
Add a way to set Figgy metadata as part of bulk ingest.
Add warnings about harmful content to our viewer

comments.body: If we have several statements (e.g., one for harmful content, and a separate one for graphic content), would it be possible to display multiple statements? Or would we need to choose one per object to display?

I think it would be better to have multiple statements. Maybe in figgy it's a checkbox sort of experience, and so if you check the "graphic" box you get one statement. If you check the "offensive" box you get another, or both, but with separate headings. This contradicts what I was saying before, but I think it might scale better if we need to add other types of warnings--otherwise we would need to come up with statements for all possible combinations.

figgy.title: Add a bulk ingest screen for Recordings from a Bag

comments.body:
Option 1: https://docs.google.com/drawings/d/16mjFnw7xsHJ56C3opp7-jRN9RkRgvvAeGG2saULKpys/edit This is the closest to what everything else looks like - which makes me happy. I don't like having that weird collection ID input - to get away from that you'd have to commit to some sort of naming convention for the bags that include the collection EAD ID (we need to be able to get the EAD to map the barcodes to component IDs)
Option 2: https://docs.google.com/drawings/d/1pg9ns9rVPgjiQ9bUsP1Hng4blZJFFMWuFI6lPHpeVnk/edit This is the closest to what you're doing right now. I'm not sure it'll work for your use cases, since it'd inherit all the visibility from the parent collection to the resulting items.
Option 3: https://docs.google.com/drawings/d/1zSY5NMi1a5jojIqBi0nZs9Dkol0xB8Ls7Dnx9aKZByo/edit This is a middle ground, where you still explicitly pick the collection to ingest into, which then acts as the choice that option 1's input box had. I'm not super excited about adding yet another ingest button, though.

We chatted about these and we like Option 1b, which is:

"Do option 1, but change the bags so they're named in such a way as everything before the first underscore is the collection EAD ID"

lux.title: Date Picker does not allow users to remove a value

comments.body:
@eliotjordan I agree this is a bug. Can you give the use case you're working on? When do you need to set a saved date to nil?

I know this is different from the stated need, but setting `:defaultDate="null"` as an attribute will set it to null for a field without a pre-existing value.
I'm working on embargo dates in Figgy. I'm using the default-date property to populate the picker with an existing value on an edit page. Users should be able to delete the value from the input.

princeton_ansible.title: Refresh certs, improve cert renewal playbook

comments.body: Rebased.
Branch rebased. ~~@sandbergja's~~ @maxkadel's PR consolidated the playbooks. Keeping the modified Slack message.
Thanks for rebasing, @acozine! To give credit where it is due, it was @maxkadel's PR that consolidated them. :-)
Ah, I didn't do my research! Thanks @maxkadel for the PR.
This change would rotate all the log files on the worker boxes daily, regardless of size. Test on bibdata-staging to confirm this behavior.
We think this was fixed by #3084.
The `uat` system is for scsb to test their own changes, more of a dev env for them. It's not well suited for us to test changes in our software. So we will use production keys in our staging env.
Retaining the `uat` key in the vault, in case we need to use it to test future releases of scsb.
